info.name: Swizi External API
info.description:
**General information**

This document describes the SWIZI APIs used for external services to manage users and groups.

All exchanges are in JSON format.

**Authentication**

The API is protected by OIDC Client Credentials flow.

**API return’s codes**

| **Status** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| 200 | Success with content in response |
| 204 | Success (no content expected) |
| 400 | Bad request |
| 403 | Access denied |
| 409 | Conflict : entity already exists |
| 500 | Internal error occured |

In case of errors, the response has the following format:

``` json
{
    "status": "4XX|5XX",
    "errors": [
        {
            "path": "specific property in query or body",
            "errorCode": "specific error code",
            "message": "specific error message",
            "location": "query|body"
        }
    ]
}

```

item.name: Auth

urlencoded.description: Client ID provided by SWIZI team
Client secret provided by SWIZI team

variable.description: Keycloak realm provided by SWIZI team

request.description: Get an access token.

response.name: Get token

item.description:
The authentication is based on the OpenID Connect standard by using the Client Credentials flow.

To access your API, you must request an access token for it. Then, you must pass the retrieved access token as a Bearer token in the Authorization header of your HTTP request.

| **Info** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| REALM | Keycloak realm provided by SWIZI team |
| CLIENT_ID | Client ID provided by SWIZI team |
| CLIENT_SECRET | Secret provided by SWIZI team |
| Discovery URL | [https://keycloak.swizi.io/auth/realms/REALM/.well-known/openid-configuration](https://keycloak.swizi.io/auth/realms/REALM/.well-known/openid-configuration) |

body.raw:
{
  "extId": "05632",
  "login": "user",
  "email": "user@swizi.io",
  "firstname": "Test",
  "lastname": "User",
  "phone": "",
  "mobilePhone": "",
  "company": "SWIZI",
  "entity": "Entité 1",
  "businessAddress": "My address",
  "function": "Test",
  "groups": [
    5,
    6
  ]
}

request.description:
Create a user.

- An exernal ID can be set to identify a user from an external service. It can be used to find/update a user instead of using the SWIZI user ID.
- If login is not set, email will be used as login by default.
- Login must be unique: if not, a 409 status code is returned.
- Groups can be assigned to user by using SWIZI group IDs.
- If one group ID is invalid, a 400 status code is returned.
    

After success, the user ID is returned.

response.name: Create user - OK

request.description:
Create users.

- An exernal ID can be set to identify a user from an external service. It can be used to find/update a user instead of using the SWIZI user ID.
- If login is not set, email will be used as login by default.
- Login must be unique: if one already exists, a 409 http status code is returned.
- Groups can be assigned to user by setting te SWIZI group IDs.
- If one group ID is invalid, a 400 status code is returned.

request.description:
Get a user by its Swizi ID.

If user is not found, a 400 status code is returned.

response.name: Get user by ID - OK

request.description:
Get user by its external ID.

If user is not found, a 400 status code is returned.

response.name: Get user by external ID - OK

request.description:
Get the user list.

- Max size by page is 1000
- the result can be sorted by : login, email, extId, firstname, lastname

response.name: Get users - OK

- Email can be updated if login is different from email.

If user is not found, a 400 status code is returned.

Update a user picture by its external ID.

If user is not found, a 400 status code is returned.

response.name: Update user picture by external ID

request.description:
Get a user picture by its Swizi ID.

- If user is not found, a 400 status code is returned.
- If no picture is found, a 204 status code is returned.

response.name: Get user picture by ID

item.name: Get user picture by external ID

request.description:
Get a user picture by its external ID.

- If user is not found, a 400 status code is returned.
- If no picture is found, a 204 status code is returned.

response.name: Get user picture by external ID

request.description:
Delete a user by its Swizi ID.

If user is not found, a 400 status code is returned.

request.description:
Activate or deactivate a user by its Swizi ID.

If user is not found, a 400 status code is returned.

response.name: Active / deactivate a user  by ID

If user is not found, a 400 status code is returned.

query.description: direction (ascendant / descendant)

request.description: Get the group list.

response.name: Get groups - OK

request.description:
Get the group members.

- If group is not found, a 400 status code is returned.
- Max size by page is 1000
- the result can be sorted by : login, email, extId, firstname, lastname

response.name: Get group members - OK

request.description:
Add users to group.

- If group or one user is not found, a 400 status code is returned.
- If some users are already in the group, there are ignored.

response.name: Add users to group - OK

request.description:
Remove users from group.

- If group or one user is not found, a 400 status code is returned.
- If some users are not in the group, there are ignored.

response.name: Remove user from group - OK

item.name: Calendar

body.raw:
{
    "start": "2024-06-10T09:00:00.000Z",
    "end": "2024-06-10T10:00:00.000Z",
    "title": "Session 1 de la formation 1",
    "organizer":1527578,
    "description": "Un texte qui décrit le contenu de la session 1 de la formation 1",
    "attendees": [1527576, 1527577],
    "masterId":"Formation1"
}

request.description:
Create an event.

The event's organizer must be set in path with user's email.  
It is possible to add attendees to event. If an attendee is known from Swizi, the event will be added to it calendar.  
It is possible to add a location to the event. If the the location is kown as a space reference in Swizi, it calendar will be updated.  
Swizi does not verifiy if an other event exists on the same time window. Conflicts must be manage by API user.

After success, the event ID is returned.

response.name: Create an event OK with externalId

body.raw:
{
    "start": "2024-06-10T09:00:00.000Z",
    "end": "2024-06-10T10:00:00.000Z",
    "title": "Session 1 de la formation 1",
    "organizer":"usr1",
    "description": "Un texte qui décrit le contenu de la session 1 de la formation 1",
    "attendees": ["usr2", "usr3"],
    "masterId":"Formation1"
}

query.description: Returns all events that take place after or from this date. The format is ISOString.
Returns all events taking place before or up to this date. The format is ISOString.

request.description:
List all events from a user's calendar.  
They may come from events where the user is the organizer, or from events where the user is a guest.

Update an event

- If the location is known from Swizi, it calendar will be updated.

request.description:
Cancel an event

Cancel an event. The event must be organized by the user specified in the request path.  
The event will be removed from all attendees calendars.

item.description: This API allows you to manage Swizi calendars

request.description:
Remove users from group.

- If group or one user is not found, a 400 status code is returned.
- If some users are not in the group, there are ignored.

response.name: Update access code with Swizi Id
Update access code with external id
Update access code KO

Remove users from group.

- If group or one user is not found, a 400 status code is returned.
- If some users are not in the group, there are ignored.
